Reviews.Title: “Value for money! Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JagadishGandhi
Reviews.Content: We did our planning & bookings at the eleventh hour. So, all the highly rated accommodation options in Venice were sold out by then. Minerva & Nettuno was the decent of the left over lot. We were a bit apprehensive about this place. But, we were proven wrong. It was basic, decent, clean and moderately priced. It is 5 minutes walk from Piazzale Roma & Ferrovia. You might miss the sign board, if you don't pay enough attention. Check-in: It was smooth. Had no issues. They insisted on cash. Did not accept cards. Only the front desk guy spoke English. It was a bit tough to communicate with others. Had to seek the help of front desk guy to others help. Room: Rooms were a bit hot & Humid. And stinked a bit at first. It was fine after switching on the AC. Latch in the bathroom door was missing. Yeah, and the water in taps was warm at best. Hotel needs urgent attention on small things like this. Otheriwse, its a basic, decent and clean place. Has no lifts. May not be suitable for old people.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from hell..”
Reviews.Author: Beekeith
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recommended by the reservations desk at marco polo airport, walking down the main street we were excited at all the lovely hotels. We then spotted this hotel. What a dump. The reception guy was rude and simply shown us across the road and said your room is up the stairs. In the room the furniture was old and filthy, no air conditioning the beds had stains on them and the single bed looked like a converted sofa. Then we thought we'd open the window. We pulled the massive curtains back to reveal a window at ceiling height the size of a shoe box!! The room was hot and humid and smelt bad too. There was a broken plug with mosquito repellant on the scruffy table god knows what wouldve hapoened in the night, probably eaten alive. We went to complain about the cleanliness and the fact of no air conditioning and no window and he said "dirty, I suggest you go to another hotel" needless to say we did! Avoid this place at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic price for main Venice”
Reviews.Author: 5Jenny5
Reviews.Content: By booking through yeego.com I got a twin room with shared bathroom for â‚¬43 a night. We stayed in room 16 on first floor which faces the street, so some noise from passing people. But nice to watch the day to day life! Sink in the room has no plug so bring one if wanted. We had a "basin wash" as the shower is on the third floor and I have mobility problems. Toilet just down the corridor cleaned regularly. Good breakfast served 8am - 10. fruit salad, cereal, yogurt, bread roll, crackers, cheese, salami, juice, fresh made coffee,tea or hot chocolate. Left our bags in reception on the last day before 10 mins walk to the bus station for 20 mins bus to the airport. We saw many people looking lost wandering around venice with baggage and loved that our hotel was so easy to find on the same road as the train station and only about 4 mins walk and no bridges!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AMRILUSAGUY
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. The room was a little small and the toilet at an odd angle but there was a television and the continental breakfast. The location is great, a 5 minute walk from the main train station and vaporetto stop. The staff are very nice and helpful and have a great deal of Venice Knowledge. If you are travelling on a budget this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, space is limited but clean and decent location”
Reviews.Author: Caldwl
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in October for one week, the hotel is ok, we had an ensuite room but the ensuite was little more than a cupboard, the tiles were cracked in the bathroom around the door and you could actually see from the ensuite to the bedroom. It was a very small room with little room to move around in but we did have two windows and air con which was much needed as it was very hot when we were there, the room was very clean and was attended to everyday, all the staff were really nice except one lady who was very rude to us but luckily she was only on duty on our last day so we didn't have much dealings with her. The hotel is in a good location for the bus and train station and is about 50 min walk to San Marco, there are good waterbus links from the Scalzi bridge and so this hotel is in a good location for seeing Venice,

Reviews.Title: “okay hotel, but better choices exists”
Reviews.Author: olsenjakob
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. The rooms are pretty basic, the reception and connecting breakfast area quite small, but still kind of cosy. We spent the first night in the annex, which was very very basic, and our daughter who had a single room, was heavily bitten by insects. Next day we were moved to the main building, which had better rooms. A very basic hotel, but we got a good price, which included dinner at a nearby restaurant. Location also good, the area around Guglie bridge is very nice - not central in relation to St. Marks Square, but close to Central Station and Vaporetto stops.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but cheap & clean”
Reviews.Author: nehabhushan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in this hotel. Location is excellent, near to Ferrovia & train station. The staff is friendly. The room whcih we got was absolutely 'no frills' & small, but clean & ok. After all we paid for only a decent sleep & shower. The bathrooms are clean. Breakfast was generous, the lady kept everything fresh. The reception keeps ur luggage in case you have checked out & ur train is late in afternoon, so u can explore the town.If u r on a budget travel this is ideal place in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: rose1991
Reviews.Content: A reasonably nice hotel in a great location, does the job for a relatively cheap visit to venedig!

Reviews.Title: “Its Venice... you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: licketylips
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel upon recommendation in Lonely Planet guide. The hotel was very clean and staff were courteous and helpful. If considering staying here ensure to ask for a room with Air Conditioning and NOT at the front facing the street - you will not sleep due to the noise from the constant flow of people outside til 5 A.M. and the mosquitoes buzzing around your ears (and it will drive you insane!).... and don't think you can just close the windows you will slowly roast due to the heat in summer. As for breakfast, ensure to go early or go very late or you will be queuing for a seat in the tiny dining room. Everything else is great - location right on the main drag and very close to train station and grand canal as well as restaurants to suit any budget.

Reviews.Title: “dress nice when you check in”
Reviews.Author: spiralisis
Reviews.Content: i believe it was because we didnt look fancy enough that we ended up with the shocking room we were given on checking in to this hotel. the positives are that it was near the train station so you didnt get lost looking for it (inner Venice is a maze). the staff were fairly courteous and the breakfast wasnt bad either as continentals go. our room however was a dingy box with blood splats on the walls from some sort of insects, which immediately led us to inspect our sheets (we have had bedbug issues before in previous travels). the sink was clogged up and the rug had not been cleaned. deciding the room was not suitably clean we spoke to the lady on the desk who apologised and moved us to a lower floor - this room was much larger, better kept, and had a bathroom and air con unit. after initially locking the bathroom door and taking the air con remote control, the staff later relented and allowed us use of the bathroom for our previous inconvenience. it was nice to have an en suite shower even if there were holes in the towels. all in all, depending on the room this hotel could be great (we looked inside the rooms on the lower floors which seemed very nice) but just be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in old town Venice”
Reviews.Author: gabyrd80
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotels is good. You are about 20 mins away from The Rialto and Piazza San Marcos. Breakfast is basic but good. The downside about this hotel is that rooms are humid and full of mosquitoes! I couldn't sleep on my first night there. It is also a little expensive for what the hotel offers but this is common among the hotels in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, best price!”
Reviews.Author: Nichakorn
Reviews.Content: I've been searching for a cheap hotel in Venice for a long time. Then, I found this hotel with very cheap price as I and my friend prefered the budget trip. As you walk along the way close to train station, you will find a small, very small hotel on your left. Staffs are all friendly and nice. Pros- low price, nice staffs, great location, easy to find, clean room Cons- tiny room, no elevator( hard for me when I have tons of bags and our room is on 3rd floor, I understand that it's a old hotel), no breakfast Anyway, I enjoyed my stay there a lot and would come back again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: Travellingwellies
Reviews.Content: Let's put things into perspective, you're in the middle of Venice, the location is amazing, you step out of the hotel into a beautiful square, there's loads to eat and drink, it's marvellous! Really great rates at this hotel, the continental breakfast was always filling, the waitress in the morning was lovely and friendly. The room was a good size with nets on the windows to keep the mozzies out and was cleaned everyday. The bathroom was shared between 3 rooms but there was never a queue or a problem or lack of hot water when you needed a shower, it was also cleaned everyday. Reception was fine, they were decent enough, we asked for a fan when it got too hot and they let us have it in the room for a week for free. The hotel has some great links to the main Vaparetto stops, we'd recommend getting yourself a travelcard from the main kiosk in front of the train station, we found it really handy when exploring the far out Islands of Venice, certainly recommend some of the farm Islands, they're beautiful. Get yourself to F'Nova and check the stops from there. Take note, there's a Supermarket down the road towards Campo Sofia so don't be tempted to spend 3Euro on a bottle of water, you get the exact same bottle for 17c in the supermarket. All in all, this was a very basic hotel but then you're in Venice, get out of your hotel room and have a look around! It does what it says on the tin and it costs a lot less than other hotel rooms in the locality, well worth it so you can spend all your hard earned cash on the fine food and restaurants (which are not cheap)

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you like to wash”
Reviews.Author: stanleycat
Reviews.Content: I had some doubts about booking a hotel without en-suite bathrooms but thought other bathrooms would be available to use- wrong- the Minerva provides 1 shower room between 3 floors. It does provide a sink in your room- but the taps leak so it helps to keep you awake and concentrates your mind on how you have to go along the corridor to use a toilet. We tried to use the shower room twice but the water was cold at both 2pm and 6pm so ended up strip washing in the sink, even then the water barely got warm. So if you like personal hygiene this is not the hotel for you. Reception staff were neither helpful nor friendly. Location is conveniently near the train and bus stations but do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for this price”
Reviews.Author: andragan
Reviews.Content: For me it' s a nice and good hotel. The room is large, across the street, but they have little basic rooms too. We have good luck to gave us this room, it's clean, and the furniture it's ok. The bathroom it's nice, and very clean all the time. The staff are very friendly especially the blond women for the reception. The food it's also good, cereals, yogourt,jam, salami,one piece of bread,tea, coffe, milk and juice. It's a cheep food, but for this price, what are you expect ?? The location it's very, very, very, good, in the middle of venice, near the bus station, about 10 min.

Reviews.Title: “A good place To stay in this price range”
Reviews.Author: 2basslakers
Reviews.Content: We didn't have high expectations because our daughter stayed in a small basic room earlier. We stayed in a larger one and had a good experience. The location was perfect - close to the train staton, restaurants, and into the heart of the city. Our room was good size with a private bath. The furnishings were basic but we aren't fussy. It was clean and because we were on an alley it was quiet. The staff were very nice and helpful. Our room was in the 2nd part of the hotel across the main street. The locked main door could have been an inconvenience but they always ran cheerfully across the street to unlock it. Breakfast was quite nice. Only complaint we could have had in hotter weather would have been the air conditioning. They have good units but do not give you the remote; you need to call someone and apparently they don't set it very cool. They either had a problem with disappearing remotes or they save cooling costs this way. Like a lot of the Mediterranean countries windows do not have screens to keep out the mosquitoes. We had cooler weather so our experience was fine

Reviews.Title: “å°�å·§ã€�åœ°é»žä½³ã€�è¶…å€¼çš„å¨�å°¼æ–¯ä½�å®¿ Small, good location, value for money in Venice”
Reviews.Author: daymoon
Reviews.Content: ç•¶ä½ ä¾†åˆ°å¨�å°¼æ–¯çš„æ™‚å€™ï¼Œæœƒç‚ºäº†æ°´é�“ç¸±æ©«çš„ç¾Žæ™¯çµ¦æ·±æ·±å�¸å¼•ä½�ï¼Œä¸€æ—¦é–‹å§‹è¦�æ‹–è‘—è¡Œæ�Žï¼Œå…‰æ˜¯æƒ³åƒ�è¦�ç¿»é�Žä¸€åº§åº§å¤§å¤§å°�å°�çš„æ©‹ï¼Œå°±è¦ºå¾—ç´¯å£žäº†ï¼Œè€Œé€™é–“å°�å·§å�¯æ„›å�ˆç¶“æ¿Ÿçš„å°�æ—…é¤¨ï¼Œå�¯å…�åŽ»é€™æ¨£çš„æ“”å¿ƒï¼Œå�ªè¦�é †è‘—ç�«è»Šç«™å‰�çš„é�“è·¯å�‘å·¦èµ°ï¼Œå¾ˆå¿«å°±å�¯ä»¥çœ‹åˆ°å®ƒï¼Œé€™ä½�ç½®çœŸçš„å†�å¥½ä¹Ÿä¸�é�Žäº†ï¼Œé›¢ç�«è»Šç«™ã€�ä¸»è¦�çš„æ°´é�‹ç«™éƒ½è¿‘ï¼Œäº¤é€šæ–¹ä¾¿ï¼Œé�žå¸¸ç¬¦å�ˆè‡ªåŠ©æ—…è¡Œè€…çš„éœ€è¦�ï¼Œé‚„æœ‰å®ƒçš„æˆ¿åƒ¹åœ¨å¨�å°¼æ–¯ä½�å®¿ä¸­ç®—ç¶“æ¿Ÿå�ˆå¯¦æƒ çš„ï¼Œæ›´æ£’çš„æ˜¯ç«Ÿç„¶é‚„æœ‰æ��ä¾›æ—©é¤�å–”ï¼� å…¶ä»–è¦�å…ˆæœ‰å¿ƒç�†æº–å‚™çš„å°±æ˜¯ï¼Œæˆ¿é–“å¾ˆå°�ã€�å»�æµ´å…±ç”¨ï¼ˆä¸€å±¤æ¨“å�„æœ‰ä¸€é–“å»�æ‰€å’Œæµ´å®¤ï¼‰ã€�éš”éŸ³ä¸�ä½³ï¼Œä½†èº«ç‚ºè‡ªåŠ©æ—…è¡Œè€…ï¼Œå�ªè¦�ä¸�æ˜¯å°�æˆ¿é–“æœ‰å¾ˆé«˜çš„è¦�æ±‚ï¼Œé€™æ¨£çš„åƒ¹éŒ¢ã€�åœ°é»žã€�å’Œæ—…é¤¨é¢¨æ ¼ï¼Œæœƒæ˜¯è¶Ÿé–‹å¿ƒå�ˆå€¼å¾—çš„ä½�å®¿æ—…ç¨‹ã€‚ When you come to Venice, you must be deeply attracted to the city of Water and Bridges. Once you start to drag your luggage, you would not like the big and small bridges, but this small, cute and economical hotel can be removed from such worries. It's close to the train station and water station, so that is convenient and economical to backpackers, and even better is that there are breakfast ! Besides, the room is very small, toilet and bathroom to share (one floor each one toilet and bathroom), but such price, location, and hotel style, is really easy to have a worth and nice trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: hellohelenhere
Reviews.Content: Clean, but walls need washing/painting (squished mosquitoes! nice!) Staff varied from lovely to sarcastically indifferent. Breakfast: we didn't bother, appeared to be just a packet of biscotti. Shower early for hot water - by 10am it's gone. Conversely, they had the heating up way too high at night. Our room was facing onto the street and a bit noisy, though with ear plugs, I couldn't hear it and slept well. Next visit, I'll bear in mind that the end of October is NOT beyond mosquito season! Americans, bear in mind that fly screens are seldom found in Europe, and a non-aircon hotel will suffer from mosquitoes, especially after wet weather (as in our case). But at this price, in this location - a good deal. And the beds were comfortable too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money in expensive Venice”
Reviews.Author: ladyl81
Reviews.Content: Hotel Minerva is in a great location and is value for money in expensive Venice. Located a five minute walk from the train station and ten minute walk from the bus station, this is the perfect location in Venice - you don't want to be lugging bags too far in this town. It's also close to the water transport, three of the four bridges that cross the Grand Canal and there's plenty of restaurants nearby. For 93 Euros in a double ensuite room on the weekend, this was by far the cheapest accommodation we found in expensive Venice. The bed was comfortable, room spacious and bathroom was clean. Our only issue with this hotel was although a non-smoking room, the room smelt quite smoky. The room was really just a place to sleep so it wasn't a huge problem but this was the only time we experienced a smoky room during our five weeks in Europe. The breakfast is good with plenty of variety and the luggage storage is very handy. We arrived to Venice at 10am and our room was ready so they let us check in early which was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and staff but not up to code”
Reviews.Author: rsharmany
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very nice and the location was great (5 minutes to train station). However, the room had water damage and you could smell the mold in the air. As a result, i became quite ill the following morning. The bathroom was also a bit too small, and I am from Europe and used to smaller bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “A balcony overlooking the Lista di Spagna”
Reviews.Author: tompSwuk
Reviews.Content: Found this place thanks to a man in a peaked sailor's cap touting hotel rooms in Santa Lucia railway station. We were backpacking en route to Albania and had assumed that finding somewhere nice and cheap to stay in Venice would be impossible. Not here. Went back the following year and got the same room overlooking the Lista di Spagna - clean, balcony, bit of character, never for once envied the saps in the three-star places paying through the nose a few doors down. Sure, breakfast's iffy and there always seems to be a drama going on behind reception but we're aiming to be back there this summer for a third time, just don't book room 2 on August 3, OK?

Reviews.Title: “Great value in venice”
Reviews.Author: sj_indian_travel
Reviews.Content: This is a sweet place to stay in venice.. the rooms were great and spacious (clean).. bathrooms were outside the room, but the price suited our budget very well (particularly in venice).. This is close enough to the railway station with lot of shopping and food choices.. but far from St. Mark's square.. but again, then u cant have everything...

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Alphen aan den Rijn, The Netherlands
Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: Annelies1984
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It's small, cheap and the people are nice. The location is very good: because it's only a one minute walk from the train station Santa Lucia (the only train station in Venice). Everything in Venice is old, the hotel was build around the year 1400. Service There is somebody at the reception 24 hours a day. They speak English and are very kind. A lady booked a tour for us by phone, for example. Breakfast The hotel is small. There is a reception, a small breakfast area and the rooms. There are about six or seven tables. The breakfast is basic: one 'panino' for everybody. There is yogurt, marmalade, cheese, meat, coffee, milk, juice and tea. Room We had room number 25. Complete with bathroom with sink, toilet and shower, an extra sink, a television, air conditioning, a table and two chairs. And a bed,of course! A very charming, typical Italian room. It has a view over main street 'Rio tera lista di spagna', so it was a bit noisy. We didn't hear the neighbors though. Location The hotel is located in Cannaregio, one of the six districts of Venice. Venice is small, so everything is close to the center. In front of the train station (so: very close to the hotel) there is a boat stop, called Ferrovia. The boats are called vaporetti and work like the underground, but then on the water, of course! You can buy tickets for a few days at the stop Ferrovia. I would advise that. The neighborhood is nice, lots of restaurants and shops around. Value We paid 45 euro's per person per night. Very cheap in Venice! Including breakfast. We booked via a travel agency in Holland. Cleanliness Spotless and clean! Housekeeping came every morning. Good to know Not all the rooms have an own bathroom. Rooms without are cheaper, but if you like your own, you can ask for it when you make your reservation. Another tip: take earplugs. My boyfriend didn't need them, but I was glad I had them. It's not very noisy, but a little. How to get there From train station Santa Lucia: step outside, enjoy the view and take a left. It's about a one minute walk. The hotel is on the left of the street. It's small, so pay attention. When you reach a small square named Geremia, you are too far. From boat stop Ferrovia: take a right. It's about a one minute walk. The hotel is on the left of the street. It's small, so pay attention. When you reach a small square named Geremia, you are too far. If you are looking for a nice place to sleep and have breakfast, Minerva e Nettuno is very good. There is no swimming pool or anything like that, but you're in Venice, so you'll have a good time anyway. Have a good trip!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate. Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: tocanada2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night after a cruise. I walked from the ship to this hotel. It is just a few minutes walk from the train station. My single room was up one flight of stairs and had two windows so there was a nice breeze. Big television but no English channels. Adequate bathroom with massive shower head. Breakfast was included and is on the main floor. Rate was E70 per night. Pros: Good location. Friendly staff. OK breakfast Cons: Lobby and breakfast area is really small. Where you leave your luggage is not very secure. Lot of noise in bedroom from restaurant staff of nearby restaurant . This hotel is adequate for one night in transit but that's all in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Look For Bruno At the Train Station. He Will Take You There!”
Reviews.Author: AWLHELPTOURSINC
Reviews.Content: Met Bruno at the train station right in front of the tourist info booth. He was very nice, spoke perfect English and took us to the hotel. Got us a great rate of 60 Euros with a very nice buffet breakfast. Yes I said he walked us to the hotel and along the way pointed out the best places to eat. YOU CAN NOT GET THAT INFO on the internet! Our room had two windows facing the street on the 3rd floor. Very happy with this hotel and its location close to the train station. I'm talking about arriving in Venice with no nothing information and here is Bruno a very kind gentleman working the station. That is how to travel! No stress right! Very easy access to the airport on departure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cheap, basic hotel with excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: bsd86
Reviews.Content: Don't expect any luxury, but if you are looking for a cheap and basic hotel with a central location in Venice, I strongly recommend this hotel. Here are some positive and negative aspects we experienced in this hotel: Positive: - Cheap: We paid â‚¬ 25 pppn for a double room with shared bathroom: the cheapest we could find in the center of Venice. - Location! It is 5 minutes walking from the Santa Lucia train station and from the bus boat stop. You can easily visit Venice by foot from here. In the street of the hotel are many restaurants and shops. - Quiet: the most of the rooms are at the back side. We had a small but nice room at the back side, with a (shared) balcony, so there was no noise from the street. Only you could hear what happened in the hallway, but apart of a cleaning women's conversation one morning (rather late), it didn't bother us. - Friendly: the receptionist that welcomed us was friendly and spoke English very well. He recommended us some cheap restaurants* in the street of the hotel. The other was less nice, but we didn't have any problems. - Breakfast is included. However, everything was the cheapest they could find, and you get only one little bread (but they gave us another when we asked for it), for the rest you have to eat muesli, yoghurt, fruit salad and zwieback. Negative: - Though the beds were comfortable, the pillows were very hard and with lumps. The "double bed" consisted in two single beds put together, so there was a hard border in the middle. - There didn't come a lot of water out of the (shared) shower. - The first night, our room was very warm because the heating was turned on and the button to turn it off was broken. We had to leave the window opened all the time, which let enter mosquitos. The next day, they had 'repaired' it by turning off the heating. Fortunately, we were not too cold later, because the button was still not repaired, so we couldn't turn it on again. Overall, the negative aspects were just details that didn't bother us a lot. For this price, it's a really good place to stay in Venice. * If you are staying in this hotel and looking for cheap food, try the restaurant AeOche, just at the same side of the street, going towards the station. They have delicious and big take away pizzas for â‚¬ 6,50. If you eat inside, they charge you service costs, like in most restaurants in Venice. The receptionist also recommended us the Brek's restaurant, also in the same street. Don't go there. Yes it was the cheapest, but you will need two dishes to not be hungry anymore and the quality was very bad.

Reviews.Title: “Close to train station”
Reviews.Author: bendybunny
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying in this small, clean and affordabel hotel. We didn't partake of any food in this establishment as there are many restaurants and quick food establishments closeby. Nothing fancy here, shared bath was very adequate and hotel was clean. If you want a place to stay, close to train station and affordable without all the unnecessary ammenities, this is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC - Value for Money (yes in Venice!) plus more...”
Reviews.Author: SpecialJose
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited lats month for 3 nights. This was a first holiday toegther since our wedding this summer (the honeymoon is next month) and I was a bit fearful as i realised Venice is very expensive and my wallet is not huge. The wife helpded by saying "I'd rather spend on clothes so keep costs down". Having reviewed several sites, I found Hotel Minerva one of the cheapest available with sound reviews. Having arrived with several suitcases and just stopped off for food, we were expecting a long journey to find this hotel. So when we were told that it was just over the bridge from where the airport bus had dropped us off, we go off to a great start to say the least. The location for me cannot be better. It is close to the train station and bus station which enter Venice, but also has the feel of really being in Venice. There are plenty of shops and (fairly reasonable) restaurants around the vacinity. The room - as i went for the cheapest, we had to share a bathroom on the 2nd floor - i knew this in advance. This was fine with me, and even the wife wasn't too bothered (eventually!)- yes an en-suite would have been better - which are available, but we wanted to keep it cheap. Speaking of which, i dont think you can find a cheaper place. I shoud state value for money becuase chaep can give the image of tacky and poor quality - but this was not the case. Anyway, this place is certainly the best priced around. The room was fine - spacious, clean and we had a great view looking down on the busy street. Quality - reviews had mentioned breakfast was not great. So i didn't bother getting up for it. The wfie did go on the last monring - she thouroughly enjoyed it. It was simple but effective and was worth getting up for...thankfully, she brought me up some breakfast in bed which was great. (So pls be aware of reviews...i will discuss a little further soon. ) Service - the people were all fantasttic - very helpful and reccomended some good places- we did try and speak Italian to them as i believe this can go a long way. i had head Venice was not too good on service but we tried to speak italian, smiled all the time and everyone were fantastic. Problem Solving - on chceking out, I was asked to pay the sum (which i believ ei had paid on reservation). The owner dealt with me very professionaly and effectivly, allowing me to call, use internet and pretty much sit on his desk to look into this. my e-mail confimred that he was right and that i had not paid. So he did indeed handle me very well. We started talking and i mentioned i would give a good and honest review - he did not like the words interent and review... explaining that when people do complain and write negative reveiws, there is no facility/option for him to put his side of the story. I guess he is right. So overall i do recommend this place - BUT please do take my 2 pieces of advice: 1. Manage expectations - i expected very little and was delighted. So do not expect the Hilton following reading my reveiw! It is very good value for money and ideally located - if you want a room just to sleep in, this is the one. If you want spa, food, wine and stay in hotel, there may be other ones more suited for this. 2, I think it helps being positve, smiling and trying to speak the local language - a little efforrt can go a long way. P.s Apologies for poor spelling....very busy at work! P.p.S - found a great take-out Pizza place around the corner from this hotel - head towards St Marks square and around the corner, over the bridge and on the right you will find the pizza place - it is by some fruit market stalls and close to a (BLODDY EXPENSIVE) internet cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: jessybobs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Minerva for 2 nights, I picked the hotel mainly because of the price and the location,, near to the station and Piazzale Roma. When i first arrived I thought " My Gosh what have I come to " The receptionist seemed very abrupt and had a gang of friends around her laughing and joking. She hardly took any notice of me. My room was on the 3rd floor, no lift, the carpet on the stairs needed a good hoovering and the metal carpet rods needed screwing down properly, could be dangerous. I was dreading opening the door, but to my suprise the room was large, bright and clean, very minimal with 70's style bedroom furniture. But I got to love that room, especially the view onto the street and the San Geremia church, with its beautiful bells, and the view over the Venetian rooftops. Yes it was noisy but the double glazing cancelled that out, it went quiet after 12am anyway. No problem with mosquitos, there was a repellant plug in the room with tablets, but I also brought my own. The shared toilet on the 3rd floor was a bit tatty, not unclean but patches of bare plaster and cement. I tended to use the 2nd floor toilet as it was nicer. The showers were clean and hot. Can't comment on breakfast as it was not included in my rate, but I bought pasries and yoghurt in the numerous bakeries around Lista di Spagna ( I also took my own Kettle and coffee) There was no safe in the room, which worried me I asked reception to keep my passport, but it was just shoved in a drawer with an elastic band around it, so next day I got it back and just kept it with me. Cleaning staff were thorough and pleasant. I would stay again at the Minerva, if on a limited budget, it was not as bad as my 1st impression. On a previous trip in June I stayed in a 4 star on the Lido, so may have been a little spoilt by that. But would chose the Minerva for the location, I loved the Lista di Spagna. I think I will be a regular visitor to Venice and the Minerva will do me fine, rather than not go at all. The other receptionists I encountered were a lot nicer than the one I met when checking in

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: goggin
Reviews.Content: We had the hardest time finding an affordable place that seemed decent in Venice, and finally decided on the Hotel Minerva. It was a reasonable price and had a great location for us. It's close to the train station and Piazzale Roma (where you leave by bus or to get to the airports), which was great as we didn't have to travel far with our luggage. Also, it's really close to the Grand Canal. The area is very touristy, though, and the street outside our window stayed busy and loud until very late at night. We are incredibly heavy sleepers, so didn't not have much of a problem, but if you are a light sleeper, a room facing this street is not for you. Speaking of windows, we had to have them open all night because there's no air conditioning and our room was on the 4th floor. In June, Venice was incredibly hot. Somehow, at night, the room was substantially hotter than the street below -- about 90 degrees in the room for most of the night. And, there were mosquitoes because the window didn't have a screen. Since it really wasn't too bad outside at night, we think that if the room had just had a fan, it would've been a lot more comfortable. But, as it was, it was pretty tough to sleep being so hot. The room was pretty clean and had a sink in it which was nice. The shared bathroom, however, was pretty nasty. It seemed really old and had some mold in it. The last day we were there, the shower was full of sand and hair and was hardly draining. Gross! If you can afford somewhere else in Venice, do it. But, if not, this was not a terrible stay -- just be prepared for some heat and bring shower shoes! We had found a hotel on Lido (Hotel Belvedere), which did not seem too expensive but the reviews listed it as far from Venice. It's only about 15 min by boat from Piazza di San Marco and you're on a boat the whole way, so it's really not that bad. If we go back to Venice, we'll probably stay on Lido because it really isn't far and seemed much nicer. Plus, Lido was beautiful! If at all possible during the summer, go for a/c though!

Reviews.Title: “Lodging on the Fly”
Reviews.Author: GSSDaring
Reviews.Content: Arriving in the Santa Lucia station after an all day train ride through the Alps I had not arranged a room for the night and was approached by a respectable looking agent asking if I was looking for a place to stay. Being too exhausted to look around the city myself, I accepted his offer and he took me directly to the Hotel Minerva. The room I received was adequate and the service a bit above what I expected. The room was somewhat poorly lit (nothing like what appears on the Expedia room photos), but relatively well kept. The bed was not the best I've slept on but for the day-weary, it was good enough. Breakfast was in a pleasant sunroom type area and was perfunctory but not unwelcome. A humble mix of basic Italian and English allowed communication with the front desk during my stay. The staff person was very accomodating the next day as I wanted to explore the city in the morning and afternoon while leaving my bags for check in at a tour-booked hotel the following night. Although the location of the hotel could be considered somewhat out of the way, the opportunities for exploring Venice were all the more enticing for finding my way through the intervening blocks (a term I use loosely as nearly nothing here is so well organized).

Reviews.Title: “Hostel”
Reviews.Author: minilie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 2 nights in this hotel that really was more a hostel. Lots of drunk teenagers very noisy until 4 am. I couldnt even have breakfast the next morning as they were staying in the restaurant , hungover, and eating at a very slow pace. The location is great however but yes, noisy at night. My single room needs to be renovated. Staff not very helpful.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Minerva & Nettuno
HotelInfo.Address: Lista D Spagna | 230 Cannaregio, 30121 Venice, Italy
